p: The different doses of N. sativa seed (1, 2, and 3â€‰g/day) in patients with DM-2 were also evaluated. A one g/day administration increased high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-c) levels after 3 months while two and three g/day of N. sativa seed significantly decreased serum levels of total cholesterol (TC) and triglyceride (TG) as well as low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-c) and increased plasma HDL-c [ 51]. In reference to modern scholars' devotion to the likely effects of medicinal herbs in diabetic management, a recent meta-analysis of antidiabetic effects of N. sativa [ 44] also exhibited the maintenance of glucose homeostasis and serum lipid profiles in diabetic human subjects [ 44, 51].
